direct_enhancements.reason: Both methods are called when the TCP state changes, specifically when data becomes available for reading or writing.
Both methods handle state changes in the TCP connection, though they handle different states (writeable vs. closed).
Both methods involve writing data to the network, though tcpWritePacket is more direct in handling the actual packet transmission.
Both methods handle data packets, though notifyPacket is more about receiving packets while onTcpWriteable is about notifying the availability of the write buffer.
Both methods involve sending data, though send is more direct in handling the actual data transmission.

enhanced_by.reason: Both methods require the socket to be initialized before any write operations can be performed.
Starting threads is necessary before any write operations can be performed, ensuring the environment is ready.
Both methods involve verifying the state of the write buffer and handling exceptions related to buffer availability.
